clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Cancer Screening in HIV Positive and Negative Women in Cambodia
clinical_study.official_title: Screening for Prevention of Cervical Cancer in HIV-positive and HIV-negative Cambodian Women Using Direct Visualization With Acetic Acid

brief_summary.textblock: The prevalence of cervical neoplasia in Cambodia is not known. There are no screening programs in place. The investigators plan on introducing a screening program based on WHO criteria and utilizing visualization with acetic acid. Patients who are positive will be offered same-day cryotherapy if indicated or will be referred for biopsy, LEEP and hysterectomy as indicated. The planned patient pool for this study is 1000 women, half of whom will be HIV positive (and thus have a presumed higher incidence of cervical neoplasia).

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of cervical neoplasia in HIV positive women
primary_outcome.description: 500 HIV positive women will be screened for cervical neoplasia using direct visualization with acetic acid

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of cervical neoplasia in HIV negative women
primary_outcome.description: 500 HIV negative women will be screened for cervical neoplasia using direct visualization with acetic acid

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment of HIV positive women who screen as positive
secondary_outcome.description: Patients who screen positive will be offered same-day cryotherapy, further diagnostic work-up, and further therapeutic options such as LEEP and hysterectomy as clinically indicated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment of HIV negative women who screen as positive
secondary_outcome.description: Patients who screen positive will be offered same-day cryotherapy, further diagnostic work-up, and further therapeutic options such as LEEP and hysterectomy as clinically indicated.

arm_group.description: 500 HIV women will be recruited from the hospital's current patient base as well as the community
500 HIV women will be recruited from the hospital's current patient base as well as the community

intervention.intervention_name: cryotherapy, further biopsy, LEEP, surgery as indicated
intervention.description: These interventions and their outcomes are not part of this study. However, we will be offering at no charge appropriate treatment for neoplasia or cancer that is diagnosed.

study_pop.textblock: The 1000 women will be recruited from the current patient base of Sihanouk hospital and the surrounding community.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female, age 30-49, able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy, gross cervical mass, prior cervical cancer, unable to give informed consent, prior complete hysterectomy, allergic to acetic acid
